item.title: Continuous litter on the paving, 28th September
item.description:
Tenants at Lorrimore Estate continuously leave abandoned bin bags and recycling on the paving rather than using the euro bins provided. THis must be addressed to the building management and if communal bins are not sufficient then provide more. The area is dirty and animals fouls around as a consequence. A jet wash of the paving must also be done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bodney road is a rubbish heap again, 28th September
item.description:
Please clean Bodney road. It is neglected. Please tell the downs parade estate to clean their rubbish. It’s been piling up for weeks. Unacceptable.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bodney Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Blue car, perhaps abandoned, 28th September
item.description:
Blue car parked outside 66 Ommaney Road SE14 since 21 Sept at least. Driver's side window fully open all that time. Street WhatsApp active but no resident can identify vehicle. Abandoned?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68,68A, Ommaney Road, New Cross Gate, London

item.title: The Oxfam clothes bank is being emptied continuously, 28th September
item.description:
The clothes bank seems not to lock properly or is easily broken into as weekly the contents is strewn across the pavement and it is never a small amount. Please put pressure on the charity involved to either remove or repair.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Light at bottom of alley leading into park is out, 28th September
item.description:
The problem is not no 10 but the lamp at the bottom of the alley leading into park. The bulb has gone and it makes it very dark going into park, which is open 24/7. Lots of people walk thru this alley from the park even at night. It’s next to 80B.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Radnor Avenue, Blackfen, London

item.title: I witnessed Rubbish being dumped in ally by resident, 28th September
item.description:
While walking my dog at 9.52am 8th sept 2025 I witnessed the driver (male) of a blue Mercedes reg KR18 URE park up on loampit road goto boot remove a large blue IKEA bag, walk down stairs to the ally empty contents over fence then carry empty bag back to same car then drive back onto the new estate. I waited 10mins to see if he turned round and come back the same way… He didn’t, this leads me to behave he resides on this housing estate somewhere. As a resident myself this is very disrespectful and problematic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fraser Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Balloon canisters litter, 28th September
item.description:
There are balloon canisters that outsiders have littered in the area, these people seem to not live in the area but use it as an area to chuck it away. In carronade place, temple close the walk way between 20 carronade place and houses connecting to 40 carronade place. In the bushes, outsiders have chucked it. Please could you place cameras as it is a reoccurring problem- to catch who is doing this, and reinstall the bin that has been removed and take away the canisters and any litter nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Temple Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garden waste dumped on pavement, 28th September
item.description:
A significant amount of garden waste has been dumped on the pavement outside No9 Shenley Road, coincidentally immediately after the front hedge of No9 was trimmed. It has been abandoned for over a week and no collection arranged, and is now blocking the pavement for pedestrians with mobility challenges.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Shenley Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
